snippet: Citing a robust economy, Prime Minister David Cameron’s government promised more austerity, while the opposition Labour Party demanded better protections for low-wage workers.
abstract: British political parties are scrambling for an advantage on the issue of the economy in the new year, with elections 16 months away and prediction that Great Britain will be one of the fastest-growing advanced economies in 2014.
lead_paragraph: Citing a robust economy, Prime Minister David Cameron’s government promised more austerity, while the opposition Labour Party demanded better protections for low-wage workers.

headline.main: British Economic Debate Opens Ahead of 2015 Vote
headline.print_headline: British Economic Debate Opens Ahead of 2015 Vote
